title.narrative: OUTPUT 1: BIRTH REGISTRATION AND CRVS

description.narrative: By 2020, Federal and Provincial governments have improved capacity for management of the CRVS system, with a focus on scaled up coverage of birth registration., which contributes to Promotion Of Care, Mental Health And Psychosocial Well-Being And Justice. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Advocacy And Public Engagement, Community Engagement, Social And Behaviour Change, Data, Research, Evaluation And Knowledge Management, Evaluations, Research And Data, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building, Systems Strengthening To Leave No One Behind. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: By 2022, 65 % of girls and boys under-5 are registered in Pakistan, with universal birth registration achieved and embedded within civil registration and vital statistics (CRVS) systems in two provinces, children access appropriate child protection preventive and/or response services, primarily through public case management and referral system in at least two provinces, and communities practice positive behaviours contributing towards a protective environment for children.

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: By 2020, Federal and Provincial governments have improved capacity for management of the CRVS system, with a focus on scaled upcoverage of birth registration.

description.narrative: Advocacy and institutional capacity improvement with UNICEF support led to the finalization and approval of CRVS regulations and bylaws in Punjab, KP and PAK, and their revision in Sindh, filling gaps in legislation and establishing interdepartmental coordination mechanisms required for a functional CRVS system and bringing them in line with the National CRVS Policy. Service delivery scale up including social mobilization efforts with UNICEF support, resulted in2,834,396children (boys: 54 per cent; girls: 46 per cent) registered ;in all provinces. Of these, 63 per cent were under five years of age. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:04/01/2022

title.narrative: Number of districts that have a birth registration service within the civil registration (in accordance with national legal requirements) in Sindh, Punjab, Khyber Pakhtunkhwa, Balochistan, PAK and GB.(59345), Text

target.value: 2021:Sindh: 5 districts and 1 urban centre (Karachi) Punjab: 6 districts and 1 urban centre (Lahore) KP and KP-NMD: 5 KP districts and 7 merged districts Balochistan: 5 districts

actual.value: 2021:Sindh: 30 districts Punjab: 36 districts KP 30 districts Balochistan: 7 divisions PAK: 10 districts GB: 2 districts
